scenes.text: The night sky splits into violet fractures as every screen in the city flashes a non-human warning. Gravity feels wrong, like the air is being pulled upward.
Emergency lights pulse through flooded tracks. Mechanical scouts drop from the ceiling and begin scanning faces one by one.

choices.label: Ambush the scouts before they alert the fleet

scenes.text: Inside the command bunker, alien code crawls over every monitor. The relay has fused itself into the city grid and is counting down.

choices.label: Hard-cut city power and kill the relay
choices.text: Hard-cut city power and kill the relay

choices.label: Reverse the uplink toward their mothership
choices.text: Reverse the uplink toward their mothership

scenes.text: A perfect human distress call echoes from a sealed service tunnel, repeating your own names back at you. Thermal scans show no human life signs.

choices.label: Mute comms and move by heat signatures
choices.text: Mute comms and move by heat signatures

scenes.text: A hidden reactor chamber vibrates with blue plasma. The beacon is seconds from synchronizing with orbiting warships.
At the top of the beacon spire, emergency channels suddenly fill with perfect copies of your friends' voices begging to be let in. The lock controls are in your hand.

choices.label: Broadcast the challenge code and collapse the spire
choices.text: Broadcast the challenge code and collapse the spire

choices.label: Open the blast doors for the voices outside
choices.text: Open the blast doors for the voices outside

scenes.text: The spire implodes into a white arc that shreds the beacon network. Alien ships lose formation and burn across the dawn horizon.
You pull back before final detonation and outrun the shockwave through collapsing tunnels. The city is scarred, but your crew makes it out alive.
The doors slide open and mimic drones flood the chamber in silence. By the time you understand, the invasion signal is complete.
